title: Victoria Bryant State Park
text:
Victoria Bryant State Park is a 502-<a href="acre">acre</a> (2.03 km2) <a href="Georgia%20%28U.S.%20state%29">Georgia</a> <a href="state%20park">state park</a> located near <a href="Franklin%20Springs%2C%20Georgia">Franklin Springs</a>. Nestled in the rolling hills of Georgia's <a href="Piedmont%20plateau">Piedmont plateau</a>, this park offers facilities ranging from picnic sites and a <a href="swimming%20pool">swimming pool</a> to an 18-hole <a href="golf%20course">golf course</a>. The North Fork of the <a href="Broad%20River%20%28Georgia%29">Broad River</a> flows through the park, adding several water <a href="hazard">hazard</a>s to the course. The park also offers a short nature trail plus a long perimeter trail that takes hikers through <a href="hardwood">hardwood</a> <a href="forest">forest</a>s. In addition, the park is home to many species of <a href="bird">bird</a>s, <a href="plant">plant</a>s, and <a href="reptile">reptile</a>s.
History.
The site was originally owned by Paul Bryant, who donated the land in the early 1950s as a state park, with the condition it be named after his late mother, Victoria Bryant.
